item.title: Ruling conservatives win Croatia election - but there's a catch
item.description: The Croatian Democratic Union won parliamentary elections on Wednesday, however they will need support from the far right to stay in power.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 18th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Call for reinforcement of 'Aspides' operation guarding Red Sea vessels
item.description: The EU naval mission in the Red Sea was launched to protect merchant ships from attacks by Houthi rebels.

item.title: Serbia angry after Kosovo gets closer to joining Council of Europe
item.description: Kosovo took another step towards becoming a member of the CoE as its members passed a report recommending approval.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 17th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Protesting Greeks show their anger at unemployment and low wages
item.description: Thousands of people have demonstrated in Athens and Thessaloniki over rising unemployment and the cost of living.

item.title: Call for release of Swedish prisoner on anniversary of Iran detention
item.description: Johan Floderus was arrested at Tehran airport in 2022, and has had limited family contact and consular access since being imprisoned.

item.title: WATCH: Two bears survive zoo fire in Crimea
item.description: Authorities are investigating the blaze which killed more than 200 animals - including lemurs, chameleons, parrots and turtles - housed in a private zoo called Tropic Park in Yevpatoria.

item.title: Croatia's bitter election pits outgoing prime minister against current president
item.description: Croatians are going to the polls to elect a new parliament, and two rival establishment figures are fighting to come out on top.

item.title: Journalists given rare access to France’s Rubis-class nuclear-powered submarine
item.description: Built in the 1980s, the submarine is being phased out from the French navy in favour of newer models.

item.title: Two further deaths at the Grand National are a stark reminder that cruel horse races must end
item.description: Suffering is an almost inevitable outcome, and it is supported with each bet placed — all just for a fleeting flutter, Elisa Allen writes.

item.title: Italy prepares to negotiate terms of fiscal adjustment ahead of EU elections
item.description: Officials estimate it will take until at least 2026 to get the country's budget deficit below the EU’s 3% limit.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 17th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: UN calls for €2.6 billion in funding to urgently help 3 million Palestinians in need of food
item.description: Northern Gaza in particular is rapidly sinking into humanitarian disaster after months of military onslaught and choked aid supplies.

item.title: Storm dumps heaviest rain ever recorded on United Arab Emirates
item.description: Authorities deployed tankers to pump away the water, but the lack of regular rainfall means many roads lack proper drainage.

item.title: Ukraine war: Russian strike hits apartment building, over a dozen killed
item.description: The bombardment comes at a critical juncture for Ukraine, who is lacking artillery and ammunition.

item.title: How 17-year-old Ukrainian Valeriia escaped a Russian re-education camp
item.description: 17-year-old Ukrainian Valeriia was abducted to a Russian re-education camp in Crimea. She tells Euronews how she made it back to Ukraine on her own.

item.title: Ukrainian president signs controversial law to boost conscription
item.description: The latest updates on the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Court allows nationalist gathering in Brussels to proceed, organisers say
item.description: The first day of the NatCon meeting of hard-right European nationalists was disrupted when police moved in to try and shut it down.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 17th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Clashes and arrests at Georgia protest over so-called 'Russian law' proposals
item.description: The demonstrations in Georgia's capital, Tbilisi, resulted in clashes that led to injuries among protesters and a police officer.

item.title: WATCH: Arrests at protest over controversial 'Russian' law in Georgia
item.description: Tens of thousands protested outside parliament in Georgia's capital Tbilisi on Monday - more unrest is expected.

item.title: WATCH: Brussels police move to shut down hard-right meeting
item.description: The National Conservatism Conference (NatCon) was set to welcome Brexit champion Nigel Farage and Hungary's Viktor Orban - authorities in Belgium had other ideas.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 16th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Seven boats carrying more than 400 migrants arrive in Canary Islands
item.description: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees says that of the 266,940 migrants trying to reach Europe last year, 97% made the treacherous sea crossing from North Africa.

item.title: Paris Olympics flame lit at Greek cradle of ancient games
item.description: The countdown to this year's staging of the ultimate world sporting event has begun in earnest.

item.title: More homes flooded in Russian region bordering Kazakhstan
item.description: The devastation continues as water levels in a local river spike again.

item.title: Fourteen detained as protests continue over 'foreign agent' law in Georgia
item.description: Tens of thousands of protesters are set to gather on the streets of Tbsili on Tuesday for a second day of protests.

item.title: German chancellor rules out decoupling from China but calls for quality cooperation
item.description: The three-day visit of Germany's leader to China comes after Beijing slammed the EU as “reckless” following investigations into whether state subsidies are giving Chinese companies an unfair advantage.

item.title: Erdogan blasts West's double standards over Iran Israel response
item.description: Turkey's president accused Western nations of double standards for condemning Iran's attack on Israel, but not speaking out when Israel bombed an Iranian consulate.

item.title: Spanish left puts housing front and centre in EU elections campaign
item.description: June's European Parliament elections will see governments working hard to turn out young voters with promises of change.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 16th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Fire engulfs historic Copenhagen Stock Exchange
item.description: Flames tore through the historic building in Denmark's capital on Tuesday, toppling its iconic spire.

item.title: 'The Europe we want': Italy's Democratic Party launches EU elections manifesto
item.description: The Italian opposition is trying hard to cut through in an election cycle where the country's ruling right-wing parties are hoping for major gains.

item.title: Greek prime minister announces party candidates for EU elections
item.description: Mitsotakis is asking voters to look beyond the appeal of famous names on the ballot, but everyday problems like rising prices are more of a concern.

item.title: In pictures: Flame-lighting ceremony for the Paris Olympics in Greece
item.description: The storied torch's 5,000-kilometre journey to this summer's games is about to begin.

item.title: Dozens of jurors dismissed from Trump criminal hush money trial
item.description: Donald Trump's unprecedented criminal hush money trial has begun, with the former president reportedly starting to fall asleep at an opening court session.

item.title: Attacks on Ukraine's nuclear plant put world at risk, IAEA warns
item.description: "We're getting dangerously close to a nuclear accident," IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said following multiple attacks against the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine.

item.title: Knife attack in Sydney church treated as 'act of terrorism'
item.description: Authorities in Sydney have arrested a 16-year-old following a knife attack that injured a bishop and a priest during a church service, declaring the incident an act of terrorism with a suspected religious motive.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 16th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Mass brawl breaks out in Georgian parliament over controversial media law
item.description: A huge punch-up has erupted in Georgia's parliament over a controversial foreign influence law, some say follows in the Kremlin's authoritarian footsteps.

item.title: Ukraine war: Blinken assures Black Sea allies of US support, Russian strikes hit Donbas and Kherson
item.description: Blinken has told allied countries that border the Black Sea they can rely on Washington's support, as Russia's war in Ukraine grinds on.

item.title: An Arab-Israel axis against the Islamic Republic of Iran is now a reality
item.description: The entire region just witnessed the whimper of the Tehran regime and the bang of Israel and its allies. It is time to capitalise on this opportunity for real political gains, Samuel J. Hyde writes.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 15th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: World donors pledge millions in aid for Sudan on anniversary of war
item.description: “We cannot let this nightmare slide from view,” warned the UN chief.

item.title: Dictatorships have never been closer — it's time for democracies to do the same
item.description: A shift in policy towards authoritarian countries, primarily regarding China and Central Asian nations, must be accompanied by a change in the sanctions approach towards Russia and its allies, Carine Kanimba and Natalia Pelevina write.

item.title: WATCH: Brawl in Georgian parliament after MP punched
item.description: One politician was hit in the face after being accused of being pro-Russian.

item.title: WATCH: Gazans return home after months of devestating war
item.description: Some 1.7 million people in the Palestinian enclave have been displaced since the Israel-Hamas war began.

item.title: Multiple worshippers and bishop stabbed at mass in Sydney
item.description: A bishop and worshippers at a church in Australia were attacked during mass by a man wielding a knife.

item.title: Hungarian opposition demands early election at campaign launch
item.description: If by 9 June, the majority of the country declares they do not want to be governed by the Orbán regime, they will fight for early elections, says the Hungarian opposition party.
